rComments: Lectures were engaging and tutorials were fun and enjoyable to attend. I would suggest attending the lectures because the slides do not contain complete information and it is your responsibility to go to lectures and make annotations. Overall the course is organized with clear grading criteria. I recommend this course and Professor Riskin.

I took EEB215 for breadth and it ended up being one of the classes which I have enjoyed the most and did the best in, mostly due to Riskin. She speaks passionately about the lecture material and reinforces lecture content through interesting real world examples. If you happen to enjoy the course material and pay attention in class, you'll do well.

- says textbook is mandatory but did great without - can just rely on lectures (I would go since she says a lot of stuff that isn't on slides) - sometimes she spends too much time on class discussions and falls behind, then talks pretty fast to catch up before tests - she's super nice! - tests are easy: MCQ, fill in blank, short answers

I'm a computer science student, and I took her class in the Summer and Fall. She knows her stuff, and puts a lot of care into her course. She brought flowers to a class of 200 for us to pick out. Such an excellent prof, she reminds me of how my mom teaches, with hard work, and care. Everything about her character is what UofT needs badly. A+ prof.
very engaging and enthusiastic prof! I wish she taught more courses so that I could take them! very caring about students and subject material, explains concepts thoroughly and is very accommodating
I took EEB215 for breadth and I'd recommend. The prof posts all the slides and the tests are pretty easy.
